AAK.caption: Mapbox tile
AAK.doc: Select any of the tiles that Mapbox has to offer. If you want to use a custom Mapbox tile that you created in Mapbox studio, select the last option labeled "Custom from studio".
AAK.name: mapbox_tile

AAO.caption: Initial view latitude
AAO.doc: Number used to set the initial center point latitude of the map view
AAO.name: initial_view_latitude

AAP.caption: Initial view longitude
AAP.doc: Number used to set the initial center point longitude of the map view
AAP.name: initial_view_longitude

AAQ.caption: Zoom level
AAQ.doc: From 1 to 20, with 20 being as close as possible to the ground.
AAQ.name: zoom_level

AAj.caption: Tile provider
AAj.doc: Choose one and use the options that concern to this provider below. Everything in the other options will be ignored.
AAj.name: tile_provider

AAv.caption: Stadia tile
AAv.doc: Specifies the tile style when using Stadia as the provider.
AAv.name: stadia_tile

ABZ.caption: Unique map name
ABZ.doc: Write a unique name to this map, so you can have more than one map in the same screen.
ABZ.name: unique_map_name

ADl.caption: Enable drawing
ADl.doc: It enables the user to draw polygons on the map, it also enables measuring distances.
ADl.name: enable_drawing

AEm.caption: HERE tile
AEm.doc: Specifies the tile scheme when using Here as the provider.
AEm.name: here_tile
AEm.options: normal day,normal day grey,normal day transit,normal night,normal night grey,pedestrian day,pedestrian night,reduced day

AHS.caption: Mouse wheel zoom
AHS.doc: If set to no, the user will not be able to use the mouse wheel to zoom in and zoom out.
AHS.name: mouse_wheel_zoom

AJD.caption: Mouse button for click event
AJD.doc: Choose what mouse button will trigger the click event.
AJD.name: mouse_button

AJm.caption: MapTiler tile
AJm.doc: Write here the name of the tile you want, exactly as written in this description. Options for tiles: basic, bright, osm-standard, outdoor, pastel, hybrid, streets, toner, topo, topographique, voyager, winter. You can visit your MapTiler dashboard to see them (https://cloud.maptiler.com/maps/) or just test them here by writing the name and seeing what comes up.  You can also use custom maps by pasting the ID of the custom map here, example is 52e243ac-e676-45cb-8589-2b6e74f2cb10, get that from your dashboard, this text will be inside the URL of the page and also inside an input box once you click on your custom map there. Of course you have to create your custom map in your dashboard first by clicking the blue "NEW MAP" button there.  And this provider is set here to only use vector maps.   On the free plan you must show the MapTiler logo on the map, enable or disable that in the option below.
AJm.name: maptiler_tile

AJn.caption: Display MapTiler logo
AJn.doc: You are required to display MapTiler's logo if you are on their free plan as explained in their pricing page.
AJn.name: display_maptiler_logo

AKd.caption: Mapbox custom ID
AKd.doc: Optional, only use this field if you want to use a tile you customized in Mapbox studio. You also need to select the option "Custom from studio" in the dropdown above, if you leave the above dropdown empty or select any ready-made Mapbox tile, this field will be ignored. Get the information to be pasted here from the studio, click the (at the time of this writting) upper right button labeled "Share", then click "Production" in the upper right corner of the popup that has just opened, then click "Third party" at the developer resources section, then select "Carto" in the dropdown, then you will get a URL, in that URL, get only a slice of it that says an ID, for example in this URL https://api.mapbox.com/styles/v1/vbritto/cl6ftj73f001q15pghq63pni5/tiles/256/{z}/{x}/{y}@2x?access_token=pk.ey... you will copy the vbritto/cl6ftj73f001q15pghq63pni5 and paste it here in this field.
AKd.name: mapbox_custom_id
